'These discrepancies might occur when the system or model underperforms for specific'
'demographic groups or for infrequently oserved input conditions in the training data.'
'Transparency'
"When Al systems help inform decisions that have tremendous impacts on people's lives,"
"it's critical that people understand how those decisions were made. For example, a ank"
'might use an Al system to decide whether a person is creditworthy. A company might'
'use an Al system to determine the most qualified candidates to hire.'
'A crucial part of transparency is interpretaility: the useful explanation of the ehavior of'
'Al systems and their components. Improving interpretaility requires stakeholders to'
'comprehend how and why Al systems function the way they do. The stakeholders can'
'then identify potential performance issues, fairness issues, exclusionary practices, or'
'unintended outcomes.'
